intro: Leptonychia melanocarpa, commonly known as the black-stemmed rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are basal, arranged in a rosette, and are covered with a fine layer of hair. The species is notable for its dark green foliage and its ability to tolerate harsh, cold climates.
